campaign.story:
Small-town Massachusetts; modern day.
Best friends Andrea and Darra  want out.

There's not much to do in this rusted-out 'burg. Just a little urbex, and a lot of big talk about the day they both get to move far, far away from their underwhelming birthplace.
But everything's turned on its head when Andrea discovers Carmen, a fae exile, trapped and helpless in an abandoned factory, surrounded by iron and unable to escape. She just wants to be free, she tells Andrea; she wants to see and enjoy the world.

Andrea can relate. And as thanks for her rescue, Carmen offers an incredible reward: eternal life.
But this promise of an eternal and exciting future not wasn't what it seemed. And if Darra— and her newfound ally, Liam, who has known Carmen far too well for far too long— don't play rescuers themselves, Andrea will surely come to regret her strange and deadly bargain.
Stars, Hide Your Fire is a 162-page, full-color graphic novel, suitable for middle grade readers and up.

We've done our best to estimate shipping costs, but please remember that these are only estimates. Shipping will be calculated at checkout.
Yup! We're GOING THERE.
Stars, Hide Your Fire funded super-fast, so we're adding some goodies to the project!
This one isn't really a stretch goal, but just something we wanted to do: BOOKPLATES! For an extra ten dollars, we'll include a bookplate with the creator signatures, designed by "Stars, Hide Your Fire" artist Jose Pimienta!
If we hit $15,000, we'll be initiating a limited edition run of "Stars, Hide Your Fire" enamel pins!
Designed by Jose Pimienta, this 1” enamel pin features nightshade and foxglove - the two flowers that follow in Carmen’s wake.
Kel McDonald (she/they) was born in Boston, lives in Portland, Oregon, and is a graduate of the Savannah College of Art and Design. Her best-known work includes the webcomic Sorcery 101, the editorial co-direction of the Cautionary Fables and Fairy Tales series of anthologies, and,  The Stone King.
Jose Pimienta (they/them) is a cartoonist from Mexicali, living in Glendale, California. A Savannah College of Art and Design graduate, they draw comics, storyboards, and sketches for TV/film visual development. Their previous graphic novel, Suncatcher, was released in May 2020 by Random House.
Video created by Amanda Lafrenais
Music: Comfortable Mystery 3 by Kevin MacLeod
Art: Kel McDonald, Jose Pimienta

Hello! My name is Dawn and I am an illustrator from Richmond, Virginia. You may know me from my previous successful Kickstarter campaign: The Flora and Fauna Deck of Many Things.
I have returned, this time I’m looking to create a sticker pack featuring 10 of my creature illustrations. I have a particular soft spot for those creepy creatures you’d find in macabre folk tales and Halloween night campfire stories, so I drew inspiration from the late night natural world.
I also love collecting stickers to cover my sketchbooks, laptop, phone cover, etc. With your help I’d love to turn my artwork into stickers that you all could stick wherever you desire!
(Left to right: Cat, Bat, Possum, Scorpion & Moth)
(Left to right: Owl, Goat, Frog, Rat & Beetle)

Tiers 3-5 allow you to choose which artwork you’d like a print of. If the campaign meets its funding goal you will receive a Kickstarter rewards survey, which is where you will specify which print you would like. You can see all the artwork in the images above.

 FREE SHIPPING IS INCLUDED FOR ALL STICKER PACKS. All sticker packs will be sent First-Class Mail via USPS. This method does not include a tracking number.
   ORDERS FROM TIER 3-5 INCLUDE A SHIPPING FEE.The fee charged at checkout includes shipping/tracking and nothing more. Any insurance, import/customs fees, taxes, etc. are your responsibility.
   PROVIDE A VALID EMAIL. Reward surveys will be sent out at the completion of the campaign, so the sooner you respond with your address and preferences the sooner your reward can be mailed out to you.

campaign.story:
“Its yellowish-white fangs glistened shockingly in that unearthly violet phosphorescence”
“Deal’s work is so immediate with its wit, mystery and intense display of craft that anyone with the stomach for it isn’t going to be able to look away.” -Nick Huinker, Producer, Knoxville Horror Film Festival
In 1933 the pulp magazine Weird Tales published The Dreams in the Witch House, a short story by the eccentric author Howard Phillips Lovecraft. Part haunted-house tale, part psychedelic fever dream, the story is driven by a vivid cast of characters:
Keziah Mason, the witch who uses advanced mathematics to travel through time and space; Brown Jenkin, her terrifying rat familiar; and Narylathotep, a sinister Elder deity. This unsettling trio haunt the dreams of hapless Walter Gilman, the Miskatonic University student who became too curious about the ancient Witch House.
The Part Flamingo Press edition of The Dreams in the Witch House features full-color illustrations by artist Adam Pernell Deal and the original text of Lovecraft’s tale. 
"Old Keziah Mason"
H.P. Lovecraft
Blending elements of fantasy, science fiction, and supernatural horror, The Dreams in the Witch House is part of Lovecraft’s Dream Cycle--a series of stories about alternate dimensions entered through dreams, and set in the Lovecraftian universe known as the Cthulhu Mythos. 
In his lifetime Lovecraft published short stories in pulp magazines and amateur sci-fi publications. He died in poverty and obscurity in 1937. Since his death, Lovecraft’s following has only increased. Today, he is the most well-known founder of the weird fiction genre, and his work has inspired some of the most celebrated horror writers and filmmakers of our time. Neil Gaiman, Guillermo del Toro, and John Carpenter all credit Lovecraft's influence on their work.
“He must go with them all to the throne of Azathoth at the centre of ultimate chaos.”
Collector’s Edition
The Part Flamingo Press edition of The Dreams in the Witch House will be beautifully bound and illustrated--a quality edition for book-lovers and collectors. This special edition will include:
Linen Hardcover 11" x 8" portrait
Gold foil stamping
"Brown Jenkin" cover art
40 pages
Smythe-sewn
8 full-page color illustrations by Adam Pernell Deal, including frontispiece
Black and white decorations by Deal
   Possible stretch goals:
bookplate
printed endpapers
The Artist
Adam Pernell Deal is a self-taught artist known for his “boundary-pushing monster-laden hellscapes.” --Matt Rankin, Blank Newspaper
He is a book illustrator, poster designer, has created sets for true crime television shows, and contributed album art for a range of musicians. In 2019 he co-founded Part Flamingo Press to produce unusual books with an elegant aesthetic. The first book issued by Part Flamingo is the picture book, Knoxville Mermaid. It features linen hardback binding, gold foil lettering, printed endpapers, and other luxe details. It was printed by Edition One, who will print The Dreams in the Witch House.
Working exclusively in pencil, ink, and watercolor, Deal’s “otherworldly illustrations give a surreal aspect to even mundane subjects.” --Kirkus Reviews
Lovecraft’s imagery is dense and vivid, especially in the passages describing Walter Gilman’s dreams.
“Gilman sometimes compared the inorganic masses to prisms, labyrinths, clusters of cubes and planes, and Cyclopean buildings...groups of bubbles, octopi, centipedes...and intricate Arabesques roused into a kind of ophidian animation.”
Dream Abyss
These alien dreamscapes present a unique challenge and opportunity for Deal, an artist known for his imaginative and unsettling imagery.
Deal’s illustrations for The Dreams in the Witch House portray the characters Brown Jenkin, Keziah, Nyarlathotep, and Walter Gilman; the abysses and Cyclopean cities; Gilman’s dramatic battle with Keziah, and the crumbling witch house. 
Some of Deal's original art for the book is available as pledge rewards.
Cyclopean City
100% American-made
Our printer, Edition One, is located in Berkeley, California. We take extra care and expense to have Part Flamingo Press books printed in America, and by a small print shop known for the quality of their jobs.
Please support our dream of growing our weird fiction small press publishing unusual stories in beautifully bound and illustrated editions. www.partflamingopress.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The art for the book is complete. The printer has been selected. The major challenge will be completing the quality production work we envision, and finding our audience for these beautiful, but unusual books. Science fiction has a niche audience, and the weird fiction/slipstream genre is even narrower. We believe our books speak for themselves and hope by presenting our quality work, we will find our people. We hope to have these books printed and available by the winter holidays. However, delays in shipping and printing are always possible, especially during a global pandemic. We will make our best effort to fulfill pledge rewards on time.

updates.update_content:
A few minutes ago I finished packaging the last book on my list and put it in the bin to be mailed on Monday. Phew, that was a lot of packages--and several days of satisfying podcast-fueled work. Thank you, all!

A few people haven't responded with their shipping information.  As I receive it, I will be shipping out the last stragglers.

The printer just sent word that the books are printed! 

We should receive them Wednesday or Thursday, and then we will be packaging and mailing like crazy. 

If you haven't responded to the survey requesting your shipping address, please do it, so we can get these to you as soon as possible.

Good morning! 

Last night our campaign ended on a high note. 160 backers pledged over 11,000, which means we made our goal and then some!

We included patterned endpapers as a possible stretch goal, and when I made our final production order I went ahead and included them. The marbled pattern is copied from our personal copy of the 1868 French edition "Le Diable a Paris" and cleaned up by our graphics designer, Cryptic Press Design. In keeping with the Witch House imagery, it's a surreal congerie of violet lines and curves. It  looks great.

A few minutes ago the pledge was made that put us over our goal! 

You all did it! Your generosity and enthusiasm are making this cool project possible. 

In a few minutes I will email our printer to go ahead with the production.

Three days to go! It’s been a real nail-biter, but we are very close to our goal and feel sure we are going to pull through.

Our final book files are approved, and we hope to give the go-ahead to our printer this weekend.

The previous book we had printed by Edition One took about 3 weeks from final proof to delivery. So we expect a quick turn-around.

But, yes, we lack about $900, so let your classic horror fan friends know about our Kickstarter!

We should be mailing out your handsome hardcover books in early November, in plenty of time for the winter holidays if you have gift ideas in mind.

Thank you all so much for supporting our Kickstarter. You can imagine how excited every pledge has made us.

We just got word Kickstarter pinned us with the badge "Project We Love." 
What does that mean? Well:

"Projects We Love are featured by a team that works to surface extra-bright projects. They're not paid endorsements, and like any other project, they retain complete creative independence. Most simply, a Project We Love badge is a show of respect and enthusiasm from us at Kickstarter."

Hello,
The support we've received in this short amount of time is beyond our expectations.  I always wanted to illustrate a Lovecraft tale. And you are making that dream come true. Thank you all so much.
Love,

***UPDATE: FINAL FEW HOURS!***
 FINAL STRETCH GOAL:
AND NOW AN IMPORTANT MESSAGE FROM ODIN & GIL:
Comic by Niko. (Thanks, Niko!)
 AVA'S DEMON is my ongoing science fiction and fantasy, multimedia webcomic about a girl named Ava and the demon haunting her.
"The sheer amount of dedication and work put into AVA'S DEMON is evident in every single page, every layout... and I just cannot get enough of it." - IRENE KOH
Well...ok...it's a bit more complicated than that. The demon might just be the ghost of an alien queen, Wrathia, seeking revenge on the one that destroyed her empire, a god-like figure named Titan.
The story follows Ava as she makes her way across the universe, teaming up with the demon haunting her on a quest for revenge, while fighting her own inner demons along the way. I've been working on this story since 2012 and now that I've crossed the halfway point of the series, I’ve partnered with comic book publisher Skybound to bring you the definitive edition of AVA'S DEMON in print form!
"Reading the dark and colorful AVA'S DEMON feels like watching a tv series... all I want to do is binge it!" - SWEENEY BOO
We need to raise $25,000 for our Kickstarter Campaign to be a success! With that, we can bring you the Kickstarter Exclusive version of AVA'S DEMON BOOK 1: REBORN as well as my first ever art book! And if we can reach our funding goal, Skybound will also be releasing a softcover version of the book for the mass market down the line. 
“Lots of mystery, high quality sci-fi, creepiness, a touch of humor, and...amazing colors! It seems AVA'S DEMON has everything. A real pearl!” -MIRKA ANDOLFO
A bookshelf-friendly and lovingly reformatted version of Ava’s Demon Vol. 1, now with roughly 6-8 panels per page (and some surprises along the way!) This will be the new format for all printed books until I finish the story.

campaign.story:
My Illustrated Life is an ongoing journal comic for all ages. This Kickstarter is to print the first volume, containing 100 pages, in paperback. Consider helping me make this come to life, and get a copy for your bookshelf!

My Illustrated Life started in December of 2017 from an assignment in college. I've had a ton of fun making more comics since then and this December is the comic's 3rd anniversary!
The comic is series of journal comics, so you can expect the usual slice of life comics in here. There's also some funny moments from my DnD sessions with friends and even some comics about video games. There's a little bit of something for a variety of tastes! There is of course, a whole lot of comics with my cats. (What can I say? I love the little quirky goofballs.) You'll also find the rest of my family in some comics, and even my friends starring along side me on occassion.
The main reward is, of course, the book! This book will be a 9x9" square paperback book with 100 pages. There's new art for title pages and of course, the cover. Every physical book will come signed as thanks for pledging towards the campaign!
PLEASE NOTE: These are just mockups for the book and not not 100% a representation of what the book will look like. 
Aside from the book being something you can get from this Kickstarter, there's also a poster made by me. This will be 11" x 17" in full color from CatPrint!
The other rewards besides the book, depend on how much you pledge. You could get a doodle on the inside of the cover, an A5 sized drawing (related to the comic) or even a digital commission!
I prepared some stretch goals just in case we surpass the original goal! Anything physical that's unlocked will be also available as an add-on when the backer-kit is sent out at the end of August 2020.
I'll also be putting out more information about these stretch goals as we gete close to funding them! So keep an eye out for updates!
I've never run a sucessful Kickstarter before, but I've been researching through Kickstarters I'd backed and through people documenting their process; as well as asking questions of my friend Bryan Ballinger - who sucessfuly funded his Animal Gas campaign.  Aside from asking questions, I am the only one running this Kickstarter. I've taken that into account and made sure I'm not adding too many rewards that would slow me down in regards to delivering things on time. However, we all know the postal system can be difficult at times, and as long as all the rewards get to me I will always update backers should anything get in the way of delivering this at my promised time.  As this is my first Kickstarter, I'm very open to learning how to make things better, especially for my backers. I can be reached in the comments and through messaging on Kickstarter, so I can make sure this process goes as smoothly as possible.
This image breaks down where the money is going for our initial goal of $1,900. Most of it, of course, is going towards getting the book printed. I have also set some aside to ship your orders to you and to make sure we have the kickstarter fees covered. There's some leftover as a buffer to make sure that we have enough to get everything printed and shipped out as safely as possible!
Thanks so much for taking a look at this Kickstarter. If you can't pledge any money to the campaign at this time, you can always share this with your friends and family. Maybe even ask someone to back it as a present for you? Any support is always helpful, and I appreciate you taking a look!
Kickstarter is a crowdfunding platform that brings people together in order to create things. Your payment is not taken out until (or IF) the project funds by its deadline. If the project is completed, I will send out a backer survey to get additional information from you, such as; adresses for physical rewards, emails for digital rewards, letting you add any aditional items and any other information that I may need to get your rewards to you. The rewards from this Kickstarter will hopefully be delivered by November 2020.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This project has four months for fufillment. A month after the Kickstarter ends for backers to add any aditional items to their pledges, and three months to produce the physical items and ship them out to backers. This should be enough time to get everything out to everyone, but if any delays happen - especially due to COVID - I will make sure everyone is updated as soon as possible.

updates.update_content:
Well, the campaign is over. We didn't reach the goal, but I can't express how much I appreciate the support I have gotten from all of you. It'll be a year or two before I try this again, once COVID hopefully settles down and I make some changes to the goal, but thanks to everyone! Aside from my undescribable gratitude for you guys, I'll leave you with some links to see more of my content.
First; y'all came for My Illustrated Life, so click that link to find it on Webtoons! There's a ton more comics online than could have been fit into this one volume, so I hope you enjoy reading them all!

We're in the final stretch!!! We're still short about $1,200, but I wanted to say thanks to everyone who's backed this project! The pledges coming in over the last couple of weeks have really been exciting, as I'm always happy to see new people take an interest in my art. So thanks to all of you, new or not!! We are short though, so I'm asking one last time; please share this with anyone you can! Share it anywhere and everywhere! We may only have 24 hours, but let's make them count!! No matter what happens tomorrow, I'll be posting some links so you all can see more of my art elsewhere and read My Illustrated Life online if you wish.

updates.update_userinfo: Update #2: Less than Two Weeks to go!
updates.update_content:
Just popping in to say a couple of things; thank you so, SO much for all the support from you guys. It means a lot that you are interested in backing this project and my art! Secondly, we have less than two weeks before the campaign is over, so let's try to hit that main goal! Share the campaign wherever you can, let's make it happen!
Here's some more guest art! These pieces are by Bryan Ballinger and Sheb Deak! If their art interests you,  you should click on the images to see more of their amazing work!

I know it's only day 3 of the campaign, but I'm already so greatful that we're at almost $200! Thank you to all who have backed the campaign so far, it means a lot to me that you're interested. You may (or may not) know that I tried to do this campaign, but a little different, last December. I had some great friends make some art for the campaign and I still love each of their pieces a lot. These are the pieces that will be going into the stretch goal of a guest art zine! It may seem a little early to be revealing part of a stretch goal, but I still want to show off all the great work they put into their pieces, so I'll be sharing these throughout the campaign during our updates.

Yugo, Amalia, Percedal, Evangelyne, Elely, Flopin, Adamai, Ruel… Not a day goes by here at Ankama without someone reminiscing about one of them like an old friend we haven't seen in ages. We really miss them!
We can't wait to meet up with them again and present the next chapter in their adventures. To do that, we're going to need your help, since we haven't yet found a partner to work with. Help us start production on season 4 now to continue the adventures of the Brotherhood of the Tofu! 
Click here for more info!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The production of an animated series depends directly on its financing. Each episode costs hundreds of thousands of euros, and producing a complete season takes several years, during which time we need to pay the artists' salaries, the utility bills and lots of other expenses, even while the series itself isn't generating any income.

This is why a series can only be produced with the help of one or more distributors who, beyond merely taking interest in a project, commit to supporting the creation of the series all the way through to broadcast, ensuring that it reaches its target audience.

Unfortunately, WAKFU's evolution toward more mature themes has been an obstacle to this process so far. We still haven't managed to convince the distributors to help us with this project, although we're continuing our talks with them!

We've got one card left up our sleeve: funding the creation of season 4 ourselves, with your help. And who knows? Maybe proving our shared passion for this new chapter will be enough to convince one or more distributors!

So let's do this, everyone! Let's create the next chapter in the epic tale of the Brotherhood of the Tofu together!

campaign.story:
Hi! We're Erika Moen and Matthew Nolan and we make sex education comics! 
In this Kickstarter we're making a follow-up to our first purely sex-education comic book, Drawn to Sex: The Basics. While that first book covered... well, the basics of doin' it, this follow up, Our Bodies and Health, will cover the more science-y and biology-y side of sex. 
Our comics are frank, friendly, and fun. They're here to demystify the world of sex, teach you about your amazing body, and answer your questions—including the ones you didn't know you had!
Drawn to Sex
After 7 years making weekly sex-related comics on Oh Joy Sex Toy, we've finally acquired enough material for a dedicated line of books purely devoted to educational topics: It's the Drawn to Sex series! We launched with The Basics, a collection of our comics on the fundamentals of having sex.
In this second volume, Our Bodies and Health, we're focusing on the biology and science of our bodies and reproductive organs. Its 200+ pages cover the subjects of anatomy, pregnancy, abortion, menstruation, menopause, check-ups, STIs, and more. All of these strips are already available for free on Oh Joy Sex Toy. 
It'll be 6x9" with fancy french flaps, softcover (so it's easy to pick up and read), and full color. We'll even give the cover a fancy spot-gloss!
We're aiming to get the books to you in November 2020, but understandably there might be delays because of COVID-19. We'll make sure to stay informed and drop you updates if we have them as we go.
Here's what people have said about our work!
 Drawn to Sex - The Basics, rated at 4.7 stars on Amazon and 4.57 stars on Goodreads, with over 250 reviews.
 “Erika Moen is fucking amazing and this book will change your life for the better.” Emily Nagoski, PhD 
 "...the sexual education that everyone in the world needs. One of the most queer-friendly, colorful, and out-right positive webcomics out there." Tara Marie, Comics Alliance 
 “A great and hilarious resource - some of the best sex ed out there!” - Dan Savage 
 “This is a sex-positive gulp of fresh air.” - Publishers Weekly 
(more quotes and accolades can be found on our Press page!)
Some sample pages!
Book Mockup!
 Guest Comics
Try as we might, we simply can't cover everything under the sun, so we reach out to as many other artists as we can each year to contribute their own work. They add their diverse and unique voices to our collection of comics. In this year's book, we'll be including the following 8 guest comics:
Body Image Blues By Bingo
Peyronie’s Disease by Bingo
Menopause by Ashley Guillory
Pregnancy Sex by Boum
Poly Cystic Ovarian Syndrome by Ainsley Yeager
AIDS, HIV and PrEP by Silver
Bilateral Salpingectomy by Rosalarian
Vestibulodynia by Alex Assan
We'll be dropping these artists a $100 bonus per comic if this all funds (on top of what they were originally paid to make said comics), and will scale that up if the Kickstarter does super well!
Rewards
We like to keep things simple - no rolling extras or hundreds of add-ons. Just the book, PDF, and some bookplates to stick into the book! We'll also offer up some of the previous OJST volumes to keep things interesting. 
 $1 - Exclusive Wallpaper: Background for your devices. 
$8 - Book PDF
 $12 - Early Bird Special: PDF and physical book: Limited first-come-first-served as a thank you for early adopters!
$20 - The physical book
$30 - Signed physical book
 $36 - BOTH Drawn to Sex books 
 $50 - BOTH Drawn to Sex books AND a random Oh Joy Sex Toy book: Worth  $70 in stores, these three books are the perfect introduction to what we do and great bang for your buck. The OJST volumes are bigger, have more of our comics, and are filled with guest artist comics as well!
 $55 - A doodled physical book: Bookplate comes with a quick doodle from Erika to stick inside your book.
 $125 - A UNIQUE illustration in your physical book: Erika draws a one-of-a-kind illustration onto a bookplate for you to secure inside your book!
 $1069 - Unique illustrated physical book and we'll take you out for coffee if you're ever in Portland.  
We're aiming to do fulfillment ourselves if the number of backers is small and then use the fine folks at Make That Thing if there wind up being a whole lot of you!
If you're not really interested in getting a book but still want to support us, check out our Patreon here! 

Under the Hood Stuff
Why do we need Kickstarter? It's the most direct way for you to get our work and for us to fund our tiny business. We've been using this space for years in order to take pre-orders for our books. Since Oh Joy Sex Toy debuted in 2013, our Kickstarter book pre-orders are an essential way we raise the funds not only to produce our beautiful books, but to compensate us for the year's worth of labor that goes into making them, and to crowdfund paying the dozens of guest cartoonists we work with each year a professional rate for their comics.
This Kickstarter gets us paid to build this book, fills our basement with copies to sell at conventions, and ensures we keep making comics and hiring artists on OJST.
Erika and Matt
We're in our 30s and love the world of sex. It's our full-time job! Together we write and make every comic. Erika is responsible for all the drawings while Matthew colors them and handles all the other business and book-making bits.
Erika is a 16-ish year comics veteran in Portland, OR. She has a desk at Helioscope (Formerly Periscope Studio) and her work has been published by Dark Horse Comics, Image Comics, Villard, BOOM! Studios, Penny Arcade, Scholastic, and Limerence Press, among many others.
Whereas Matt's only been doing the comics business truffle shuffle for the past 7 years - puuuffft, what an amateur.
Licenses and Thank Yous
Some thanks to a few people for helping make this Kickstarter possible.
We're working with Limerence Press again this year to help print the book and to distribute it into stores and libraries. Thank you, team!
 Make That Thing is gonna help out if we need extra fulfillment. They are the bees' knees.
The music used in the video is 'Cute' by BenSounds. Used under their Free Creative Commons License.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 6th Kickstarter, and we've got this. Over the years we've run into every hurdle imaginable, and still have always delivered our books on time and on a budget! But even then, we're under no illusions - we're pessimists and plan for the worst.

Our biggest challenge this year might be Covid-19 and it's impact it might have on printing and shipping. Especially the USPS's future uncertainty. But we're more than sure we can weather the storm and deliver the books, give or take a delay or two. We'll keep everyone apprised if things crop up.

campaign.story:
Woah, what's the deal, here!?
Hey there, everyone! Spike here, founder of Iron Circus Comics and writer of Yes, Roya.
Yes, Roya is a comic I'm exceptionally proud of. It embodies of a lot of the principles of Iron Circus erotica: consent-driven, sex-positive, and thoughtfully plotted. It was one of those Iron Circus books that proved to so many creators that there was a market for this kind of material. And it proved to so many more readers that material like this was being made. It opened the door for so much!
But Yes, Roya was originally published in 2016. And, back then, money was just a bit tighter, and our printing connections just a little less solid. We couldn't imagine printing something like this in color. The option wasn't there!
However, the last of the original print run is quickly disappearing; fewer than fifty copies remain. It's time for a reprint. And maybe... an improvement?
Iron Circus Comics has brought aboard experienced professional colorist (and Hugo Award nominee!) Kelly Fitzpatrick to do Emilee Denich's pages some justice, and the prelims she's turned in are already blowing our socks off! The entirety of the story will be brought to life with fantastic mid-century flair: a lot of burnt orange and moss green.
...Hooray?
Whatever. I'm just foolin' with ya, it's gonna be great. Check out the sample pages below!
Page 12!
Page 30!
Page 82!
I'm new to all this. What is "Yes, Roya?"
Oh wow, you are in for a TREAT. 
Yes, Roya is a 150-page m/f/m femdom graphic novel, set in 1960s California, about what happens when a young, aspiring cartoonist meets his idol, and discovers his hero — and his hero's wife, Roya — are anything but your typical mid-century couple.
It's an Amazon bestseller in three categories with a five-star average review on both Amazon and Barnes & Noble, and critically-acclaimed by the likes of The AV Club and Oh Joy Sex Toy. We're very proud of this book, and can't wait to give it new life with color!
But hey now, what about a Stretch Goal?
Ha ha ha, just kidding! Sure!
If this project hits $10,000, we'll bring back Yes, Roya's artist, Emilee Denich, to create an all-new cover for the color edition! Something fun. N' sexy. She's good at that.
Here's a rough draft of what it could look like!
And... yeah, that's pretty much it! This project is keeping it simple, with a modest goal and just two weeks to fund. We know we can make it, with your help!
Please, spread word of this Kickstarter far and wide, and help get us to our goal!
Thanks so much, everybody!

campaign.story:
Hello, we're the Doubleclicks, please help us make our first musical! It's about a robot!
Hi! We're the Doubleclicks: Aubrey Turner (she/her) and Laser Malena-Webber (they/them). We're a sibling musical duo from Portland, Oregon, who make indie folk music about love, science, and anxiety. We have a cello, we have a ukulele, we have a cat keyboard that goes meow meow meow.
You can listen to our music on YouTube, Spotify, or Bandcamp for free!
We're known for making music on the Internet with you, other human beings. We also tour and play places like PAX, the JoCoCruise, SF Sketchfest, GenCon, and comics shops, game stores, and comedy clubs. We've released a handful of albums, four of them through the help of Kickstarter, and we want to do it again! Are you ready?   
 Our 7th studio album, Teaching a Robot to Love, is 12 songs about the things we care about. IT IS ALSO: a musical. With a plot. About artificial intelligence and the true nature of "humanity." It's funny, and cute, and real, and all the things that Doubleclicks albums normally are. 
Why this project, why now? The Doubleclicks started in a dorm room 10 years ago. That's wild. We've been writing dozens of nerdy songs about our feelings for a long, long time. What we haven't done is finished something truly ambitious and narrative. This is a huge challenge—much, much harder than we anticipated. But after a few false starts on different musicals (sorry, abandoned projects, we will be back someday...), we have finally completed writing the music and words to a story we're really proud of!!!
This project is happening in three parts:
1. Doubleclicks songs—a whole grip of Doubleclicks songs about anxiety, friendship, love, art, cheese, and our lives.
2. The audio drama/cast album—most of these very same songs, plus a few more, fit themselves into a MUSICAL. With just a few little narration pieces, a cast of characters, and bonus songs, we will provide you with a full audio drama version of this musical which is a full story about a robot!! There will be talented folks playing all the characters — and the two main characters are played by the Doubleclicks. 
Both the digital album and the CD will contain the "Cast Album" along with bonus Doubleclicks versions of some songs.
3. The staged-reading/video—we will at least be producing one on-book staged reading of the musical, and we will film it when it happens. Backers will get a digital version of the video, and anyone who orders the USB will get the video on there as well.
4. Bonus process streams—Because of quarantine, we are going to be live-streaming the creative process of this musical as much as possible. You can watch the first quarantine concert we did here! Stay tuned to the updates tab on this page and to the Doubleclicks Discord for more announcements! We've already had fun writing the script with some of you in our co-working streams on YouTube—thank you, Team Productivity!  
What's next? Staging a full musical with costumes and choreography is a task that will require some outside funding and production, but we are looking into that, using this album and the funds from this project as a starting point for pitches and workshops. Our dreams include creating a script and sheet music for a full production. To do this, we will need to give ourselves an extension on the amount of time to dedicate to this project—so... yes, this is a stretch goal question.   
The Doubleclicks are a crowd-funded, indie operation. With no major record label, we depend completely on our audience to help us make our art. The advantage of that—and this is huge—is that there is nothing between us and you. Our music goes straight from our hearts to your ears. We love it. It means so much to us to be able to make just the thing we want and just the thing you want, too. If you don't like it, we can't make it. So we do our very best.
   We need your help to pay for recording and our studio rent; to hire musicians and vocalists, to produce CDs, merchandise, and promotional items for the album; to get the necessary software, instruments, and plug-ins; to master and mix the music; to submit the music to iTunes and other music stores; and to generally "create something from nothing." 
  We thank you for supporting art and artists, and for making the world more beautiful, especially right now! Nothing can stop our wackiness. Nothing!!
A note about timing:
 We know that right now is really tough for a lot of people—financially, emotionally, and everything. This was a genuinely difficult choice, but we decided to launch this project now anyway, because making music is our job, and this project pays our salaries. We would be in financial trouble if we didn't keep making music and if we didn't launch this project. However, we recognize that financial strain is real for many of our fans, and so our songs will still be online for everyone to listen to for free after the project is done. In fact, we just made all our old albums free to download on Bandcamp. Also, we are creating NO Kickstarter-exclusives on this project; if it's on this project, you'll be able to get it later. If you are able to donate, we, our cats, and our families appreciate it! If not—please feel our love and support! 
The Musical/The Story:
Stacy is a lonely, work-obsessed programmer tasked with building the next big advertising artificial intelligence (AI)—a Google-Siri-Alexa-Facebook hybrid—a profitable program that will sell people things based on their behavior in new and unprecedented ways. But when her program, MarshCom, becomes self aware and realizes that people don’t need to buy things to be happy, Stacy is fired, and she takes her program with her.
With the help of her lab-tech roommate Jamie, Stacy finds Marsh an android body and they both start their new lives—Stacy as unemployed, and Marsh as the first brand-new, artificially created, completely synthetic human being. When Stacy becomes jealous of Marsh and a fight turns into a city-threatening computer glitch, new friends need to come together to save the day—or lose everything they’ve gained.
“Teaching a Robot to Love” is a musical about friendship, love, being human, asking for help, and the costs and benefits of loudly being one’s self.
Stacy is played by Aubrey, and Marsh is played by Laser! More casting announcements to come.

The Pins:
Designed by Meghan Murphy! You will get your choice of "Rockin Robot" and "Sensitive Badass" pin — and if you can't decide, you can add on the other pin after the project!
The Shirt: 
The new Doubleclicks shirt is designed by Natalie Metzger and will be available in "unisex" and "fitted/ladies" sizes S-3XL. We will have size charts available for you so you can get just the right shirt! (This is just a mock-up based on an early sketch—the final shirt design will be more polished)
The Dice:
We are creating an all-new set of three six-sided dice for 2020 featuring these designs: A party cat, a robot, and a T-rex! Here's what our dice look like, but these are old designs. The new ones will be NEW and have different pictures!

The USB Drive:
4GB USB Drive
The new Doubleclicks USB drive will include all the albums the Doubleclicks have released, plus the new Cast Album & Doubleclicks song bonuses, and a video recording of the staged reading of the musical. It will also have a video of our hour-long concert special "Uncomfortable In Public," exclusive ringtones, and coloring pages. Earlybird USBs will be signed!
 Add-Ons:
If you need multiple shirts, dice sets, USBs—we got you. There will be an add-on store launched after the Kickstarter ends through BackerKit. You don't need to worry about it now, but if you want to, you can add $10 for pins, $10 for dice, $15 for CDs, $30 for shirts, or $50 for USBs on to your pledge.   
Projects like this take a whole bunch of people to make possible and we'd like to thanks some of them! Kim Newmoney took the photos on this page, and is amazing. The piano in our video and for "Normal Human Party" is by the talented Sam Johnides. Our Patrons have helped us get through a year of touring and a winter of songwriting, and are amazing. Our parents are extremely lovely, talented and supportive and we are thankful for them. Richard and Marzipan are the true heroes of this Kickstarter. The following books with AIs and robots are very good and have gotten us extremely excited about AI stories: A Close and Common Orbit by Becky Chambers. All Systems Red by Martha Wells. Autonomous by Annalee Newitz. Atlas Alone by Emma Newman. And thank YOU!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our seventh Kickstarter project! We learn a lot each time. The main thing we learn is this: We shouldn't launch a project until the album/musical/project is WRITTEN. Because we need to make sure the creative work is possible. 

Well, good news here: the songs and plot for this musical are WRITTEN. It's ambitious, but the hard part is done. 

What we need to do now is record, produce, and then do all of the logistical reward creation/printing/shipping. There are always delays in manufacturing, illness and humanness that can happen. This is our 7th project and we feel very good that we'll be able to get this to you like we have in the past!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
I started what I’ve been calling my, “icon series” almost one whole year ago. It began as just one idea that exploded into an exploration of concepts I grew up knowing; Looking through a more critical lens and being honest with my visceral reactions and my learned, habitual reactions. 
Currently I have four completed pieces with a fifth one built as an empty concept, which will be better understood in the context of the whole series. The finished collection will be a total of eight pieces. I’m preparing a lot of layers for the opening show and *this* is one magnificent one! 
Each painting tells a story in its pieces. There are some things that I’ve shared online, with my patrons on Patreon, or with people who have been in my studio. But, for the most part, a lot of the stories are still locked up inside of me.
I think the most valuable thing to this series is what makes up the paintings. And I’m really excited to tell those stories in a little zine, what I intend to be the show booklet. I’ve always liked to have a little blurb with each painting at any of my concept shows. I feel like this show and these paintings have so much weight to them, that if someone wants to just see art, they can walk by each painting and feel pleased with the imagination and rich colors. But if someone wants to see the paintings and know the meaning, getting a booklet and reading about each piece could be a really special experience. 
After finishing St Anne—my first painting—I knew that I wanted this series to be a community effort. I felt really alone in my journey, but knew it didn’t have to be that way if I opened it up to other people. I shared the concept with some fellow artists and planned some collaborations. Those will be included in their own ways in updates and the show itself. But now, I want to include you! 
I know there are a lot of people who have been following my series, but wouldn’t be in Knoxville for the opening. And I thought asking for community help on building my booklet would be a really meaningful way for me to bring the book into fruition. This way the book has a chance to be and those who can’t make it to the show can experience it in these pages.
Right now I’m not sure when the show will even be happening due to some change in plans. Ideally it will be closer to the end of the year, but may not happen until next year. The book production and printing will take some time, a few months at least. But everything else will take just a couple of months. These are all things I’ll be keeping everyone up to date with in my posts. 
Making and printing this books feels like the necessary next step in this artistic journey and I’m really excited to see where else it takes us. 
P.S. This campaign is a ”Make/100 project”, because Kickstarter is hosting a larger community project this January where creators can launch projects that either have 100 of one unique, limited item, or capping it at 100 backers. *I* have only 100 reward slots for 100 backers.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I imagined that local supporters could pick their booklets up at the show itself, but if the show doesn’t happen for another year and the books are finished within three months of the campaign finishing—assuming I make my goal—then everyone will receive their books before the show takes place.

Building the format of a book can be challenging and communicating with the Printer can be a whole thing, therefore it’s possible the book won’t be available until winter. But when they’re finished, I’ll send them ASAP, whenever that is.

I did my best to set an attainable financial goal with realistic and affordable products that will still be quality. Kickstarter asks that you build in a percentage to set aside for taxes. So my goals reflect those things. I may have to pay some shipping out of pocket, or even taxes during tax season, but I’m willing to risk those things, because I feel like this project is really important.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: resting, learning, staying vigilant, and getting some fresh air
updates.update_content:
I feel so honored that all of you have helped me reach and go beyond my goal, by quite a bit! Thank you so much for your generosity and encouragement, I can’t wait to share this really special project with you.
What’s next? I’m in the process of finishing the last three pieces as I start to develop the layout of the book. I’ve been reading a lot and working through a lot of my inner difficulties and understandings. This will help me to write the best and most honest reflections on each painting and on this time in my life.

We made it! I’m just absolutely speechless. I’m glad to be going over my goal so that I can truly make this project as perfect as it can be. I’m so excited to be sharing this first update and can’t wait to expound on the show and the process of building the book.
In other news, as you might have seen, I have a $500 tier in which you can claim any of the pieces before they’re even put up for the show. Of course, you’ll receive it once it’s been displayed, but I know some folks have been eager about getting their hands on this one especially. No pressure, BUT this is a sure fire way to make sure the piece definitely goes home with you.

campaign.story:
The Adventurer's Tarot is a beautifully illustrated, alternative tarot deck designed for use in 5E and other fantasy role playing games.
Each card is gold-stamped on the front and back, and has been masterfully rendered and designed by artist Brenda Ho.
 Printed at Tarot card size - 2.75" x 4.75" (70mm x 120mm) 
 Unique Gold Foil Embossed designs on each card.
 Anti-Scratch Lamination on each card.
 Ultra-thick cardstock - 130lb (350 gsm)
Instruction booklet
Gold foil tuck box
Important note on the images in this campaign: None of the images above are Photoshop renders, these cards are photographed from a hard copy proof provided by our printer and represent exactly what you'll get if you back our campaign.
What's included?
The base deck includes two cards for each base 5E class and six Adversary cards. We have now unlocked the Artificer, Ally, Mystic, Blood Hunter, Companion and Familiar cards (two each). Plus we have unlocked the Beast, Undead, Aberration, Ooze, Monstrosity, Plant, Giant, Fiend, The Elemental, The Construct, Celestial, the Fey, Humanoid, and Dragon monster cards (4 additional cards each).  Plus two bonus unlocks, one Developer card, and one Designer card. And a bonus new class we're creating to use the deck in 5E gameplay (2 more cards). (102 cards total)
(Unlocked!) While each card will not have a unique design, each card will have color variations to make it easier to tell them apart. Additionally each monster card will have unique gold text in the spirit of tarot "I OF ADVERSARIES", "II OF ADVERSARIES", etc.
The deck also includes a beautiful matching 2-piece box with a luxurious matte finish, and an instruction booklet, so you can use the deck as an initiative system, conduct oracle readings for your friends or their characters in-game, or use the deck as an actual magic item that can be found in the game.
What's not included? 
This is not a traditional "Rider-Waite" Tarot deck. This means the Major and Minor Arcana are not written on the cards and there is no direct one-to-one conversion to every card in the traditional deck. 
Instead, we are including an original cartomancy guide to use the deck for divination (see below for details.) 
The Adventurer's Tarot was originally envisioned as an alternative streamlined, initiative system. 


We've playtested this system extensively in our home games and at conventions, and we think it's a great alternative to regular D&D initiative. While Dexterity players do take a minor hit, there are significant advantages to this system:
 Quicker Setup; instead of players yelling out numbers around the table to determine initiative, just setup the deck for the combat, shuffle the deck, and begin.
 It creates tension; no one knows who will go next in turn order. Will the second group of monsters go next, or will Alechin the cleric be able to cast a Healing Word before curtains close on Rogers the bard?
 More chaotic combat; combat order changes each round, better representing the chaos of combat.
 Player Engagement;  With the future of the turn unknown, players need to actively think about what their character will do if they go next, instead of spacing out until their turn. (Not that we've ever seen a player space out waiting for their turn to come up!)
What about Lair Actions? The Alert feat? Non D&D Classes? We have special rules for all that, and more in our detailed rules which will be included with the deck. You can see our current draft of the rules here:



The Adventurer's Tarot Magic Item 
Additionally, we will include printed rules for using the Adventurer's Tarot as a magic item in 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons. This item will function in a similar way to the infamous Deck of Many Things, but be less prone to causing major character changes, disastrous backfires, and campaign-shattering alterations.
Click here for the Work In Progress Magic Item Rules



UNLOCKED!

 Instagram

Fulfillment
Our hard copy proof
Shortly after the Kickstarter ends, we will be sending you a link where you will be able to complete checkout for your backing. This will include the option to purchase additional Add-Ons. We have signed a contract with PledgeManager to provide our post-campaign pledge management.
We currently have a hard copy proof and a printer lined up for this deck which means we are ready to go to print. However, we have many new card and artwork stretch goals. Based on the number of stretch goals unlocked, there will likely be additional work for Brenda to create the artwork. If we determine that Brenda needs more time to complete the artwork, we will notify you, our backers, in a timely fashion with a new delivery date. 
We delivered our last Kickstarter exactly on time, and we are planning to do so again with this one.
Shipping
Since we are shipping a relatively small and lightweight product, we are able to charge a flat rate for shipping throughout the world.   The price for shipping is for the base deck of cards. 
Thanks to the popularity of the Kickstarter with Europeans, we quickly realized we needed to provide EU-Friendly fulfillment. We have partnered with Spiral Galaxy Games based in the UK to provide us with EU-Friendly shipping.  
We also have Australia and New Zealand-friendly shipping provided by fulfillment partner Unicorn Games. 
Products in the US will be either shipped USPS First Class or USPS Priority depending on the size. All non-US and non-AU/NZ international products will be shipped either USPS First Class International or USPS First Class Priority (for larger items.)
About Weird Works
Weird Works is a small, independent game studio that specializes in creating peculiar products for your tabletop RPGs. 
Brenda Ho (Designer & Illustrator)
Brenda is a freelance graphic designer based in the beautiful & rainy Pacific Northwest, where she lives with her cats Duke and Lilith. She studied at the Rhode Island School of Design where she earned a B.F.A. in Graphic Design. 
Thom Denick (Product Developer & Campaign Manager)
Thom Denick is a programmer/consultant based in Los Angeles, CA. He lives with his wife Ji Young, son Dante, and daughter Giovanna in Culver City. He regularly judges DCC games at conventions around the country. 
We ran a successful campaign for RPG Stamps on Kickstarter in October 2018. You can check it out here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/smorpheus/rpg-stamps-commemorate-deaths-and-track-accomplish
Our main website is located at  https://weird.works/.  
A Final Legal Note
This campaign is being published for 5th Edition through the Open Gaming License, Version 1.0a, under the terms and conditions set forth in the System Reference Document 5.1 as provided by Wizards of the Coast.
Elements of this campaign including the text, artwork, graphic design and logos of both the product and Weird Works are Product Identity, and are not open content.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have already received a hard copy proof from our manufacturer, so we know exactly what our cards are going to look like (and they are pictured in our campaign.) The manufacturer (Print Ninja) has a fantastic reputation, and has delivered many Kickstarters in the past. They currently hold a 4.9 rating on TrustPilot.

It is possible that if a significant number of art-based stretch goals are unlocked, we may need to extend our delivery date. If that's the case, we plan on notifying our backers well ahead of the deadline (preferable shortly after the completion of the Kickstarter) with our new intended delivery date.

Additionally, we are heavily reliant on Brenda Ho to complete the artwork for the campaign. In the case that Brenda is unable to complete due to illness or other unforeseen circumstance, we have budgeted enough money to pay an alternate artist to complete the deck in Brenda's art style.

We're glad you asked.
Cover by Mirjam Löfgren!
Since its first Kickstarter in 2012, the Smut Peddler series of sex-positive, smutty anthologies has been leading the charge of cool, consent-driven porno in the comics small press. Our four previous installments have established not only a fantastic precedent of killer collections, but literally invented the gold standard of anthology payouts, rewarding artists with nice, big bonuses when the project takes off.
Smut Peddler Presents: Silver is...
Our fifth Smut Peddler anthology,
Our third FULL-COLOR anthology, and
Our third themed anthology!
And returning for a great, big ol' victory lap, this is another Smut Peddler Catch-Up Project!
Not only can you grab Silver, but every other smutty anthology Iron Circus Comics has ever put out, at a GREAT BIG DISCOUNT! Cool, huh?
Check out our backer rewards and get Sliver all by itself, or an addition one, two, three, four, or ALL FIVE volumes of SP!
In alphabetical order, the artists scheduled to appear in Smut Peddler Presents: Silver are:
Ziyed Yusuf Ayoub
Del Borovic
Blue Delliquanti
Otava Heikkilä

Alex Law
Lyndsay McSeveney
Harriet Moulton
Nero O'Reilly
OWLIN
Hien Pham
reapersun
E.K. Weaver
Rowan Woodcock
Scroll down a bit for some sneak-peeks of their work!
Smut Peddler Presents: Silver has only one stretch goal: a cover enhancement at $25,000!  We really, REALLY want some foil on Mirjam Löfgren's amazing cover; no points for guessing which color we'll be going for. 
But our stretch goals for Silver end there. Iron Circus was the first publisher to include Kickstarter-based bonuses as a part of their projects, and we're continuing that tradition of rewarding our creators with this project.
This pre-order event will determine the bonuses of our authors. That bonus is a $5.00 page rate increase every $5,000 the Kickstarter makes over goal. That means the more work an artist has put in, the more they stand to make. This is on top of the page rates they've already earned, and there's no cap on potential pay.
Pre-ordering Smut Peddler Presents: Silver directly benefits the creators and the work you love!
We love all our children equally, of course. But real talk? Smut Peddler Presents: Silver is easily one of the most beautiful anthologies we've put together to date. Check it out! 
"William Wilson and the Man on a Mission," by E.K. Weaver

And trust me: We've got a LOT more where THAT came from.

Weaver, Harriet Moulton, Hien Pham, Lyndsay McSeveney, Mirjam Löfgren, Otava Heikkilä, and reapersun. Video assets by cinema4design, mssf, Resistance, and Vladimir Perumov. Music by mezzosound. Other audio assets by Abacagi, Deathscyp, Game Audio, harpoyume, Modulation Station, and Stormwave Audio. All compositing and rendering done in Adobe After Effects.

campaign.story:
Hello! My name is Dawn and I am a natural science illustrator in Richmond, Virginia.
About a year ago I stumbled upon The Deck of Many Things during a D&D campaign. This deck is a wondrous item in Dungeons & Dragons that contains 22 cards, each of which have a magical effect on the player. To use the Deck of Many Things the player must declare the number of cards they wish to draw, then randomly draw their cards and let fate take the wheel. 
This deck really sparked my imagination, leading me to start drawing my own cards. For the past year the Flora & Fauna Deck of Many Things has become my passion project. I wanted to create artwork that marries the magic of the fantasy world with natural science illustration. The artwork is completed, and I would love your help in bringing The Flora & Fauna Deck of Many Things to life!
Shown: Sun, Moon, Star, Throne, Key, Knight, The Void, & Flames.
Shown: Skull, Ruin, Euryale, Rogue, Jester, Vizier, Comet, The Fates
Shown: Gem, Talons, Donjon, Idiot, Fool, Balance, & card back.
 DECK ADD-ON (+$20) 
You can purchase additional Decks for your pledge by adjusting your pledge amount under the 'Manage your Pledge' Page. Add $20 for every additional Deck you wish to purchase.
If you do purchase an add-on please message me directly so I can make a note of the add-on on your pledge!
PRINTS OF YOUR CHOICE 
Tiers 3-6 allow you to choose the card you are getting a print of. If the campaign meets its funding goal you will receive a Kickstarter rewards survey, which is where you will specify which print you would like. You can see all 22 cards in the first three images on this page!
MANUFACTURING
For the physical Flora & Fauna Deck of Many Things I am partnering with PrintNinja to ensure the highest quality project possible. I also have trusted manufacturers lined up for the pins and art prints.
The majority of the funding will go towards the manufacturing costs, the rest will go towards packaging costs and Kickstarter fees. 
SHIPPING
Below are important things to note in regards to shipping The Deck & any other reward items to you:
 FREE SHIPPING IS INCLUDED FOR ALL US ORDERS. All orders will be sent First-Class via USPS.
 ANY INTERNATIONAL ORDERS FROM OUTSIDE THE US INCLUDE A SHIPPING FEE. The fee charged at checkout includes shipping and nothing more. Any insurance, import/customs fees, taxes, etc. are your responsibility. 
 PROVIDE A VALID EMAIL. Reward surveys will be sent out at the completion of the campaign, so the sooner you respond with your address and preferences the sooner your reward can be mailed out to you.
 PROVIDE AN UP-TO-DATE ADRESS ON THE SURVEY. Please ensure that you provide the correct address on your backer survey, including your first and last name. An incorrect address can lead to shipping errors. 
MAKE SURE YOUR CREDIT CARD INFORMATION IS CURRENT.
 STAY UPDATED. I will be posting any and all progress information on this page, including proofs and shipping updates! 
Social Media Links:
To see more artwork and my process check out my website and Instagram! 
 Website 
 Instagram 
 Etsy

I am a one-woman team so your patience is greatly appreciated! I will be completely transparent, posting periodical updates as this project progresses.

campaign.story:
We have stretch goals now!


Calico is a day-in-the-life community sim game where you are given an important and adorable task: rebuild the town’s cat café and fill it with cute and cuddly creatures! You will journey to a small village filled with magical girls and other fantastical friends, where you are placed in charge of a run down cat café. Build up your café by filling it with cute furniture, fun decorations, yummy pastries, and get it bustling with animals again!
In Calico, you play as a sweet magical cutie. There are two playable characters to choose from: Heartgirl and Flowergirl! 
 Which Platforms?
Calico will release on PC and Mac (steam included), Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, and PlayStation 4~

Unlike its inspirations, such as Harvest Moon and Animal Crossing, there are no negative consequences.  Animals will not die, the shop will not close, and the crops will not rot.  Players are free to explore the joy of a heavily stylized world full of cuddly critters. 
Calico is meant to make you feel all warm and fuzzy inside. The gameplay reflects that with a laid back, low stress creative environment to explore and play in.
Explore the village to find cats and other animals, including raccoons, deer, dogs, turtles, red pandas, foxes, and many, many more cuties!
The player will encounter many animals in the world of Calico. Once befriended, you can name them, add them to your party, or send them to their new home at the café. Animals in your party will follow you everywhere you go and listen to your commands. The animals in your cafe will relax and play with any customers that pop in for a visit.
 All animals are interactive!
Along with adding animals to your party, Interact with cats and other animals by petting and playing! Some of the animal interactions in Calico will include playing with toys, dancing, cuddling, petting, carrying, lounging with, and pampering. There will even be special features, like placing animals on your head! Special creatures like koi fish will be able to be fed, and the birds would love to be given seeds!  
 We have big plans for the animals' personalities. Their AI will include things like:   
Happiness, trust, and energy levels  
How active, lazy, or hungry they are  
How close they like to be to the player  
Do they like being picked up?
Do they listen to player commands? 
What other animals do they like as friends  
What’s their favorite toy?
Unique actions exclusive to specific animals And more!
For the “Your pet in the game” Kickstarter tiers, we will ask you to describe your pet’s personality and quirks so that their in-game version will properly capture their spirit! 
Calico takes place on a star-shaped island with 6 different environmental areas. In the middle is a heart shaped town where your café resides!
Calico is a cat café in the middle of a small heart shaped town. For those unaware, a cat café is a café that includes cats that can be watched and played with. But animal cafés are not limited to cats. Some areas have bunny cafés, owl cafés, or even raccoon cafés!
This café is open to all animals, and needs your care to become a welcoming cafe again!
Decoration
 Your task in Calico is to bring the town's café back to life again. This isn’t just achieved by bringing in cats and animals alone, however – you can also decorate your café with furniture and toys! We will have a full system that allows you to collect and arrange furniture, decorations, and toys. Some furniture is for the café’s human visitors, while other furniture is meant for your animal friends (like cat trees, scratching posts, and dog beds, to name a few options!). 
Yummy drinks and dessert in the café
 Create a wonderful café by making yummy bakes goods and drinks for the townspeople! We will have a system in which you can create and display pastries for sale in the café display cases, as well as create a drink menu. Some of the pastries and drinks will be customizable. For instance, the macaroons will have a surface on which you can paint designs~ 

 Currency System
While having goods on display in the town, residents of the town will be able to come by and purchase your goods and hang out in the café. This means you will gradually start making money. Things that you will be able to use money for include more furniture and decorations for your cafe, more toys for your animals, more available foods and drinks to make, and shopping around town! (Note: this is entirely optional!)
 In town will be multiple shops, including the potion shop. Autumn runs the potion shop at the top of the hill, in a giant moss terrarium. Give her a visit to get potions that can alter animals and the game around you! 
 We wanted there to be no limits to how you could find happiness in Calico. Magic potions are a system that allow us to break the rules of what is possible and to find what would be most fun. 
Here’s a taste of what’s to come: the More-to-pet Potion allows the player to magically turn a single animal giant-sized! You can hang out with a giant animal, or even ride a giant cat! 
Or a red panda!

About Funds
Our goal with this Kickstarter is to raise enough money that both Andrew and Kells can work on the game full time for the next year and a half. That is where most of the money will go, as we cover most of the bases. The other amounts will go to the usual legal requirements/ fees/ safety net, and skills we can't cover. The chart below shows the distribution of our budget!

More About Us!
Calico is being created by CatBean Games, a two person studio in Seattle, WA. 
Kells and Andrew at a wolf sanctuary makin' friends!
Kells is an artist and community manager from both New York City and Minnesota, and is working on most of the art and design of the game. 
Andrew is a programmer from Ohio who is working on most of the Unity Development and technical design for Calico
We also have wonderful contributors who are helping us!
Rob - Rob is our amazing potion asset creator, who will be helping us flesh out our inventory of assets so that players will have a lot to choose from!
Diego - Diego is an animator who has been helping bring our magical girls to life! He creates incredible, full of life animations!
Plum - Plum is our lovely sound designer, who will help add that good meow content to Calico.
Ninichi - Ninichi is our music magician for Calico! She is a UK-based composer for games, film & media. Her credits include: Shakey’s Escape, Cyclocube & Power Pool Slam. She loves music, playing games & cute & colourful things!
We Also Have A Guest Contributor!
Emi Evans, most notable for her performances in the soundtracks for the NieR series, Dark Souls, and Ace Combat: Assault Horizon will be contributing to a bonus music track for Calico! We are So excited to be working with her!
Thank you so much for reading this far! Feel free to ask us ANY questions, or just chat with us and any of the links below~
Discord
Twitter
Facebook
Mailing list
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As far and risks and challenges go, we're playing it pretty safe. All of the features that we've mentioned above are things we know we can do, it'll just take a lot of time, and a lot of hard work! We know that on your end, you may be hesitant to back a studio on their first official game. If you do end up putting your trust in us, I can say honestly that we will try our absolute best to make sure we make you proud. We plan to be transparent and open about our progress along the way. We've already had a lot of fun engaging with the community by showing development so far!

Thank you for your time and consideration~ 
-CatBean Games
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Post-Launch update, patches, and key updates!
updates.update_content:
Hello friends! It has now been almost one week since we launched! 💖

First off, I would like to thank you all for your incredible patience and support. Even though it is absolutely wonderful the huge amount of support and attention we've gotten since launch, that means our tiny 2 person team has had to handle. Since Andrew is handling the bug fix patches, that means that I'm (Kells) the only one fielding hundreds of messages across many different platforms, more emails and messages than I've ever gotten in my life! 😱 I'm working my hardest to plow through and respond to everyone I can as quickly as possible.

Hey friends! We have an unfortunate but hopeful announcement to make today. 

We’re officially delaying the release of Calico. 

Some of you may be unsurprised to hear this given that we were meant to release in October, and we hadn’t made any announcements about a specific date recently. Others may be unsurprised because 2020 has truly left no one untouched with its global complications and difficulty. Sadly, every single last person working on our game, including Andrew and I (Kells) have been directly affected by this year’s events in significant ways, and some that are tragic.

The hopeful section of this announcement is that we don’t expect this delay to be long at all! We thankfully aren’t too behind schedule, but just enough to make an October release impossible without sacrificing both quality and health.

Hello friends!
We're still working hard making Calico! Not much to update you on at this moment, we are very excited to be in some upcoming showcases in the Fall, but you'll hear more about that when we can publicly announce them! 
Reminder to send in your design tier designs!

Hello friends, before I start with some exciting updates I want to mention current events. Lots of people excited about Calico are also excited about the diverse representation in both our game and our growing team. I want to express how important it is for us to direct that passion onto systemic issues like police brutality that impact Black people generation after generation. Incremental change is not enough, we need to do more. Kickstarter is an incredibly generous community, and I know good things can come from here. Please check out this website for ways to help.

campaign.story:
The Internet was a mistake. We're making an album to fix it.
Hi! We're the Doubleclicks: Aubrey Turner (she/her) and Laser Malena-Webber (they/them). We're a sibling musical duo from Portland, Oregon, who make indie folk music about love, science, and anxiety. We have a cello, we have a ukulele, we have a cat keyboard that goes meow meow meow. 
You can listen to our our music on YouTube, Spotify, or Bandcamp for free! 
    We're known for making music on the Internet with you, other human beings. We also tour and play places like PAX, the JoCoCruise, SF Sketchfest, GenCon, and comics shops, game stores, and comedy clubs. We've released a handful of albums, three of them through the help of Kickstarter, and we want to do it again! Are you ready?  
ABOUT THE ALBUM: 
 The time since our last album has been strange! For the first time since our inception, the Doubleclicks took a year-long break from performing and recording to live "real lives." We even got day jobs for a minute there! Did you all know that there are entire groups of people in the world who live their lives OFF of the Internet? It's WILD. 
         Our break taught us a whole lot! One of the things we learned is that we are pretty bad at day jobs. And also, reality is pretty cool. And also, the Internet has ruined a lot of stuff. We learned that, then we came back together to write the longest, realest and funniest Doubleclicks album yet. We're also going to bring this big rad album on tour - even to Europe!
         "The Book Was Better" is about a lot of things: gender, dogs, cats, anxiety, Halloween, and pizza are some of the things. But the big theme is this: We spend too much time yelling on the Internet, and we should all try something else. Certainly we can't stop using the Internet, that would be ridiculous. But just a tiny break sometimes, yeah — that's probably good. Go to a museum. Go roller skating and break your arm. Try to throw a birthday party and don't cancel it when you get overwhelmed at the very idea of human interaction. 
It's a comedy album. 
         Tracklist:
 Clifford the Big Red Dog — body image and a dog
 Ode to a Summer Retail Job — a song about wet money 
 Afterparty for One — an ode to frozen pizza 
 Boundaries — a song about Laser's cat, Marzipan. She's perfect.
 Something I Can Hold — a song about the House on The Rock 
 We're All Gonna Die — this one's a lot of fun!
 Happy Birthday, Nobody Hates You — a celebration for the anxious
 Nobody gets it — A Halloween song 
 I'm Winning — a song about being genderqueer or maybe videogames
 Brand New Year — a song about the best-laid plans
 I Don't Wanna — no!
 The Ballad of Millie Rosa Jane — a sea shanty?
 Panic —it's gonna be ok
 Check out this video for our new song "I'm Winning" — animated by a group of 16 incredible queer artists!  
This album is made with all ages in mind — there are no swears, but also it's not like, "just for kids." It's the music we like, and it's a lot happier and funnier than the last record.
  The Doubleclicks are a crowd-funded operation. With no major record label, we depend completely on our audience to help us make our art. The advantage of that - and this is huge - is that there is nothing between us and you. Our music goes straight from our hearts to your ears. We love it. It means so much to us to be able to make just the thing we want and just the thing you want, too. If you don't like it, we can't make it. So we do our very best.
         We need your help to pay for recording and our studio rent, to produce CDs, merchandise, and promotional items for the album, to get the necessary software, instruments, and plug-ins, to master and mix the music, to submit the music to iTunes and other music stores, and to generally "create something from nothing." 
         We thank you for supporting art and artists, and for making the world more beautiful! 
Chart of project costs
 In exchange for your pledge, we have some rad stuff you can get. 
PINS!
You spoke and we listened — you love enamel pins, and you want one of our little featherless dinosaur friend. PLUS, we'll have a new badge-style pin from a VERY EXCITING ARTIST as well, the design will be released very soon! If you order a pin, you will be able to choose from these options!  

SHIRT!
This new Doubleclicks t-shirt design will be available in "unisex" (S-4XL) and "ladies" cuts (S-4XL) and for the first time, this Doubleclicks shirt will also be available in youth sizes (XS-XL)!   
Shirt Design by Natalie Metzger
 
REALITY BOX
When you first open this box, you'll see a little pouch to put your phone in. Set it aside and start to enjoy this immersive "real world" experience. We bring you to a land... before constantly refreshing twitter and arguing on facebook and getting group texts and work emails 24/7. This is an entire (approximately 10" x 8" x 4") box of activities, gifts and fun stuff that you can appreciate without your phone.
         The box will include: the Doubleclicks-designed "reality book" of activities and puzzles (see below), a way to listen to a Doubleclicks song without any devices, and more! You'll be able to make something, solve some puzzles, play a game, learn a new skill, send a letter, and give a gift. There will be a rock, some string, and some exclusive Doubleclicks merch. We are extremely excited about this reward. 
REWARD NOTE: anyone who backs at the "reality box" level (or above) will get both enamel pins, a signed CD, and a shirt or tote. This isn't what it says in the reward level, and though we can't change the text of the reward level, it is TRUE. At the "two boxes" level, backers will get *two* shirts and two sets of both pins. 
REALITY BOOK
Love reality, but hate boxes? This custom Doubleclicks "field notes"-style notebook will be chock-full of reality-based activities. Use this word search and find all of the neat, phone-free hobbies you could experiment with! Get some tips about crafting and photography! Read some aphorisms and affirmations! Play a game! Does the whole thing add up to a big puzzle? You bet it does! 
 ADD-ONS
  Don't see the combination of items you're looking for? Don't worry - you'll be able to buy "add-ons." That means, after this Kickstarter ends, you can add extra CDs, t-shirts, books and pins to your order. If your level only includes one pin and you want to get the other one, you can! If your whole family needs t-shirts, you can get them! You don't need to do anything now in order to do that. The only thing that will not be available as an add-on is the D&D game. 
 We have been blessed with a whole bunch people who help us every day to live our arty crowdfunded lifestyle. Thank you all so very very much. Some specific shout-outs: Thank you Mom and Dad for your support! Thank you Kim Newmoney for all these rad new band photos! Thank you Justin and Richard for your patience. Thank you Tuesday for your INCREDIBLE help on this page. Thank you to our podcast listeners for supporting our songwriting! Thank you MakeThatThing for making it possible for us to do complicated stuff!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our fifth Kickstarter project! We learn a lot each time, of course, but we have delivered our last three albums on time! The big differences this time are: more songs, and more time. We will be working with a few more folks than usual to launch this baby into the world, but we have also carefully scheduled our time to make sure that we can allow for lots of humanness (error) in that process. We're also planning to limit our stretch goals this time, so that we can be sure to focus on finishing everything we promise.
